author: derekg.base
content: Might be obvious to other folks, but today I learned ([geth PR](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/31788)) that blob data (and commitments and hashes) arenâ€™t unique per-transaction or per-block. seems like spamoor makes these cases more likely at high blob counts

author: barnabasbusa
content: <@360491619402776577> do we use peerdas-devnet-6 branch for devnet-7? If so could you rename the branch? Or do we still use `marius-engine-getblobs-v2` ?

author: barnabasbusa
content:
Ok, so for peerdas-devnet-7 my current plan is
37 nodes total - 1 bootnode
36 validating nodes (matrix of all working EL/CL)
18 of them supernodes (50%)
18 of them non supernodes (50%)

Each node has 8 validators only - that way even if validator custody is fucked, it won't cause any chaos.

Last time 8gb machines caused some issue, so we gotta go with 16gb machines, and we need 250GB at least due to insane amount of blobs.

FULU fork on Monday around noon (CEST)

Any oppositions? Otherwise I'll be spinning these machines up in a couple mins.

author: barnabasbusa
content: We just had peerdas-devnet-7 genesis. Find all the useful links here: https://peerdas-devnet-7.ethpandaops.io

author: barnabasbusa
content: Fulu scheduled to be active on monday
